00019   using namespace std;
00020 
00021   const Math::real LambertConformalConic::eps = numeric_limits<real>::epsilon();
00022   const Math::real LambertConformalConic::eps2 = sqrt(eps);
00023   const Math::real LambertConformalConic::epsx = sq(eps);
00024   const Math::real LambertConformalConic::tol = real(0.1) * eps2;
00025   // Large enough value so that atan(sinh(ahypover)) = pi/2
00026   const Math::real LambertConformalConic::ahypover =
00027     real(numeric_limits<real>::digits) * log(real(numeric_limits<real>::radix))
00028     + 2;
00029 
00030   LambertConformalConic::LambertConformalConic(real a, real r,
00031                                                real stdlat, real k0)
00032     : _a(a)
00033     , _r(r)
00034     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00035     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00036     , _e(sqrt(abs(_e2)))
00037     , _e2m(1 - _e2)
00038   {
00039     if (!(_a > 0))
00040       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00041     if (!(_f < 1))
00042       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00043     if (!(k0 > 0))
00044       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00045     if (!(abs(stdlat) <= 90))
00046       throw GeographicErr("Standard latitude not in [-90, 90]");
00047     real
00048       phi = stdlat * Constants::degree(),
00049       sphi = sin(phi),
00050       cphi = abs(stdlat) != 90 ? cos(phi) : 0;
00051     Init(sphi, cphi, sphi, cphi, k0);
00052   }
00053 
00054   LambertConformalConic::LambertConformalConic(real a, real r,
00055                                                real stdlat1, real stdlat2,
00056                                                real k1)
00057     : _a(a)
00058     , _r(r)
00059     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00060     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00061     , _e(sqrt(abs(_e2)))
00062     , _e2m(1 - _e2)
00063   {
00064     if (!(_a > 0))
00065       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00066     if (!(_f < 1))
00067       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00068     if (!(k1 > 0))
00069       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00070     if (!(abs(stdlat1) <= 90))
00071       throw GeographicErr("Standard latitude 1 not in [-90, 90]");
00072     if (!(abs(stdlat2) <= 90))
00073       throw GeographicErr("Standard latitude 2 not in [-90, 90]");
00074     if (abs(stdlat1) == 90 || abs(stdlat2) == 90)
00075       if (!(stdlat1 == stdlat2))
00076         throw GeographicErr
00077           ("Standard latitudes must be equal is either is a pole");
00078     real
00079       phi1 = stdlat1 * Constants::degree(),
00080       phi2 = stdlat2 * Constants::degree();
00081     Init(sin(phi1), abs(stdlat1) != 90 ? cos(phi1) : 0,
00082          sin(phi2), abs(stdlat2) != 90 ? cos(phi2) : 0, k1);
00083   }

00085   LambertConformalConic::LambertConformalConic(real a, real r,
00086                                                real sinlat1, real coslat1,
00087                                                real sinlat2, real coslat2,
00088                                                real k1)
00089     : _a(a)
00090     , _r(r)
00091     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00092     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00093     , _e(sqrt(abs(_e2)))
00094     , _e2m(1 - _e2)
00095   {
00096     if (!(_a > 0))
00097       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00098     if (!(_f < 1))
00099       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00100     if (!(k1 > 0))
00101       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00102     if (coslat1 == 0 || coslat2 == 0)
00103       if (!(coslat1 == coslat2 && sinlat1 == sinlat2))
00104         throw GeographicErr
00105           ("Standard latitudes must be equal is either is a pole");
00106     Init(sinlat1, coslat1, sinlat2, coslat2, k1);
00107   }
00108 
00109   void LambertConformalConic::Init(real sphi1, real cphi1,
00110                                    real sphi2, real cphi2, real k1) throw() {
00111     // Determine hemisphere of tangent latitude
00112     _sign = sphi1 + sphi2 > 0 ? 1 : sphi1 + sphi2 < 0  ? -1 :
00113       atan2(sphi1, cphi1) + atan2(sphi2, cphi2) >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
00114     // Internally work with tangent latitude positive
00115     sphi1 *= _sign;
00116     sphi2 *= _sign;
00117     real
00118       m1 = mf(sphi1, cphi1), lt1 = logtf(sphi1, cphi1),
00119       m2 = mf(sphi2, cphi2), lt2 = logtf(sphi2, cphi2),
00120       sindiff = abs(sphi1 * cphi2 - cphi1 * sphi2);
00121     real sphi0, cphi0;          // Use phi0 = tangent latitude
00122     if (sindiff > eps2) {
00123       // sphi0 = Snyder's n, p 108, eq 15-8
00124       sphi0 = (log(m1) - log (m2)) / (lt1 - lt2);
00125       cphi0 = sindiff < real(0.7) ? sqrt(1 - sq(sphi0)) :
00126         // cos(phi0) = sqrt( - (sin(phi0) - 1) * (sin(phi0) + 1) )
00127         sqrt( -(logmtf(sphi1) - logmtf(sphi2)) / (lt1 - lt2)
00128               * (sphi0 + 1));
00129     } else {
00130       // Set phi0 = (phi1 + phi2)/2
00131       sphi0 = (sphi1 * sqrt((1 + cphi2)/(1 + cphi1)) +
00132                sphi2 * sqrt((1 + cphi1)/(1 + cphi2)))/2;
00133       cphi0 = (cphi1 * sqrt((1 + sphi2)/(1 + sphi1)) +
00134                cphi2 * sqrt((1 + sphi1)/(1 + sphi2)))/2;
00135     }
00136     _n = sphi0;                 // Snyder's n
00137     _nc = cphi0;                // sqrt(1 - sq(n))
00138     _lat0 = atan2(_sign * sphi0, cphi0) / Constants::degree();
00139     _lt0 = logtf(sphi0, cphi0); // Snyder's log(t0)
00140     _t0n = exp(_n * _lt0);      // Snyder's t0^n
00141     _t0nm1 = Math::expm1(_n * _lt0);      // Snyder's t0^n - 1
00142     // k1 * m1/t1^n = k1 * m2/t2^n = k1 * n * (Snyder's F)
00143     _scale = k1 *
00144       (_nc == 0 ?               // if phi0 = pi/2, n = t = m = 0, so take limit
00145        2/( sqrt(_e2m) * exp(eatanhe(real(1))) ) :
00146        (lt1 > lt2 ? m1 / exp(_n * lt1) : m2 / exp(_n * lt2)));
00147     // Scale at phi0
00148     _k0 = _scale * _t0n / mf(sphi0, cphi0);
00149   }

00151   const LambertConformalConic
00152   LambertConformalConic::Mercator(Constants::WGS84_a(), Constants::WGS84_r(),
00153                                   real(0), real(1));

00155   void LambertConformalConic::Forward(real lon0, real lat, real lon,
00156                                       real& x, real& y, real& gamma, real& k)
00157     const throw() {
00158     if (lon - lon0 > 180)
00159       lon -= lon0 - 360;
00160     else if (lon - lon0 <= -180)
00161       lon -= lon0 + 360;
00162     else
00163       lon -= lon0;
00164     lat *= _sign;
00165     real
00166       phi = lat * Constants::degree(),
00167       lam = lon * Constants::degree(),
00168       sphi = sin(phi), cphi = abs(lat) != 90 ? cos(phi) : 0,
00169       m = mf(sphi, cphi),
00170       lt = logtf(sphi, cphi),
00171       tn = exp(_n * lt),
00172       theta = _n * lam, stheta = sin(theta), ctheta = cos(theta);
00173     x = _a * _scale * tn * (_n > eps2 ? stheta/_n : lam);
00174     if (_n > real(0.5))
00175       y = (_t0n - tn * ctheta)/_n;
00176     else {
00177       // write as
00178       // _t0n * ( (1 - ctheta)/_n - (tn/_t0n - 1)/_n * ctheta )
00179       // _t0n * ( stheta^2/(1 + ctheta) / _n
00180       //          - ((t/_t0)^n - 1)/_n * ctheta )
00181       // _t0n * ( stheta^2/(1 + ctheta) / _n
00182       //          - (exp(_n * log(t/_t0)) - 1)/_n * ctheta )
00183       // _t0n * (ax - bx)
00184       real
00185         ax = (_n > eps2 ? sq(stheta) / _n : lam * theta) / (1 + ctheta),
00186         fx = lt - _lt0,
00187         bx = ctheta * (abs(_n * fx) > eps ? Math::expm1(_n * fx) / _n : fx);
00188       y = _t0n * (ax - bx);
00189     }
00190     y *= _a * _scale * _sign;
00191     k = _scale * (m == 0 && _nc == 0 && sphi > 0 ?
00192                   sqrt(_e2m) * exp(eatanhe(real(1))) / 2 :
00193                   tn/m);        // infinite if pole and _n < 1
00194     gamma = theta * _sign;
00195   }
00196 
00197   void LambertConformalConic::Reverse(real lon0, real x, real y,
00198                                       real& lat, real& lon,
00199                                       real& gamma, real& k)
00200     const throw() {
00201     y *= _sign;
00202     x /= _a * _scale;
00203     y /= _a * _scale;
00204     real
00205       /*
00206         rho = hypot(x, rho0 - y)
00207         rho0 = _a * _scale * _t0n / _n
00208         _n * rho = hypot(x * _n, _a * _scale * _t0n - y * _n)
00209         tn    = _n * rho / (_a * _scale)
00210               = hypot(_n * x/(_a * _scale), _t0n - _n * y/(_a * _scale))
00211         theta = atan2(_n * x/(_a * _scale), _t0n - _n * y/(_a * _scale))
00212         lam = theta/_n
00213       */
00214       x1 = _n * x, y1 = _n * y,
00215       tn = Math::hypot(x1, _t0n - y1), theta = atan2(x1, _t0n - y1),
00216       lam = _n != 0 ? theta/_n : x/_t0n;
00217     real q;                     // -log(t)
00218     if (_n != 0 && tn < real(0.5))
00219       q = -log(tn) / _n;
00220     else {
00221       real
00222         b1 = _t0nm1 - _n * y,
00223         tnm1 = (sq(x1) +  2 * b1 + sq(b1)) / (tn + 1); // tn - 1
00224       q = _n != 0 ? - Math::log1p(tnm1)/_n :
00225         -2 * (_lt0  - y) / (tn + 1); // _t0nm1 -> _n * _lt0
00226     }
00227     // Clip to [-ahypover, ahypover] to avoid overflow later
00228     q = q < ahypover ? (q > -ahypover ? q : -ahypover) : ahypover;
00229     // Recast Snyder's 15-9 as
00230     // q = q' - eatanh(tanh(q'))
00231     // where q = -log(t) and q' = asinh(tan(phi))
00232     // q is known and we solve for q' by Newton's method.
00233     // Write f(q') = q' - eatanh(tanh(q')) - q
00234     // f'(q') = (1 - e^2)/(1 - e^2 * tanh(q')^2)
00235     // Starting guess is q' = q.
00236     real qp = q;
00237     for (int i = 0; i < numit; ++i) {
00238       real
00239         t = tanh(qp),
00240         dqp = -(qp - eatanhe(t) - q) * (1 - _e2 * sq(t)) / _e2m;
00241       qp += dqp;
00242       if (abs(dqp) < tol)
00243         break;
00244     }
00245     double
00246       phi = _sign * atan(sinh(qp)),
00247       m = mf(tanh(qp), 1/cosh(qp));
00248     lat = phi / Constants::degree();
00249     lon = lam / Constants::degree();
00250     // Avoid losing a bit of accuracy in lon (assuming lon0 is an integer)
00251     if (lon + lon0 >= 180)
00252       lon += lon0 - 360;
00253     else if (lon + lon0 < -180)
00254       lon += lon0 + 360;
00255     else
00256       lon += lon0;
00257     gamma = _sign * theta / Constants::degree();
00258     k = _scale * (m == 0 && _nc == 0 && qp > 0 ?
00259                   sqrt(_e2m) * exp(eatanhe(real(1))) / 2 :
00260                   tn/m);        // infinite if pole and _n < 1
00261   }
00262 
00263   void LambertConformalConic::SetScale(real lat, real k) {
00264     if (!(k > 0))
00265       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00266     real x, y, gamma, kold;
00267     Forward(0, lat, 0, x, y, gamma, kold);
00268     k /= kold;
00269     _scale *= k;
00270     _k0 *= k;
00271   }
